comment: He is definitely not easy.. But helps students. Overall a good professor if you put in the work and study you will get an A.

Dictator! should not be teaching. I made a B in class. Tests are detailed and tricky (purposely). He is knowledgeable in the field but needs to be educated on teaching. Ppts are helpful and follow the books assigned. overall interesting class but professor needs to relax a little, takes things too seriously

The teacher is fine! It's a senior course. I feel students in my class were expecting to be handed an A w/o putting any effort of earning it, which shows in their complaining reviews. 2 quizzes, mid/final exam (MC & essay), group project (paper & presentation, & attendance. Use the power-points he provides & read the book for studying.

The teacher is fine! It's a senior course. I feel the students in my class were expecting to be handed an A instead of putting any effort of earning it, which shows in their complaining reviews. 2 quizzes, mid/final exam (MC & essay), group simulation (paper & presentation), & attendance. Use the power-points he provides and read the book.

Incredibly detailed tests with questions written a very tricky manner. Treats class like he thinks it's high school--he's so paranoid he literally moved us to a larger classroom (where I've taken many past exams) for the exam because he was afraid we would cheat. AVOID!!

The material of the class is hard but Dr. Edoh does an amazing job in explaining it in details. He is very passionate and knows the material very well. If you don't want to learn and want an easy A, then he is not the teacher for you. He asks for feedback for improvement and works with you so you can pass the class. he doesn't want any one to fail

Very nice guy. However his grading is not very justified. He docks points from assignments such a presentations but provides little reasoning for why points were lost. He began the semester teaching then put the teaching in the hands of the students through back to back presentations. Easy class, but frustrating

Great professor! I transferred from a tier one university and professor Edoh is not cut out for z Kennesaw state. Shallow students in Class who I wonder if they really are political science or IA majors at all! He literally spoon fed us and all I heard was complains because we had to study. I would definitely take him again.

Professor Edoh is an amazing professor who it's passionate and knowledge about international law. I learnt alot about the international system and he is very candid about it.  Some students got edgy when he spoke about disparities in the west. But it is what it is. I would take!  We had really rude students in class and he handled it well.

He is horrible!!! He will make you feel small in class. He is unclear on the material and his 2 tests are way too in depth. AVOID!!!!I have taken many difficult professors and have appreciated them. This guys is not good!!!

DO NOT TAKE! He is not cut out for teaching!! Hes a great guy outside of class, but has no idea how to maintaing control of a class room! If you want to learn about Togo and how America should save Africa, take him. If you honestly want to learn, AVOID.

he does not take questions well in class. when asked a question heeither dances around the topic or he insults the intelligence of the of the student asking the question. then prods the class to continue to ask questions when these results are all that are receive. He conducts the class in a tyrannical way all while belittling the students.

I wouldnt reccomend him at all. While he is a very nice person outside of classin class he gets angry if students are not asking questions. He also seems only concerned for Africa. As this is an International Law And Orginization class I would expect the topics to range from area to area. However He does want to input on to improve the class.

Professor Edoh is a good guy, but he is not the easiest of professors. I took this class because I thought it would be an easy elective, I was very wrong. Exams are papers, and graded harshly. One group project. Lots of busy work throughout the semester, he's hard to deal with, and attendance is mandatory. Wouldn't recommend taking this class.

He's a decent guy, and what he teaches is like his life, that's how important it is. But he just isn't cut out to teach. He is too short tempered, too petty for college students, and his assignments--fit for a PHD student, not for undergrad. Too hard and too general. Imagine a crying pikachu. That's how you'll feel with his classes, lol.

He takes attendance and if you don't show up to class, even once, he makes passive aggressive remarks about you in front of the class. He has stopped teaching now and is making us give presentations on each chapter of the book, but has not once mentioned us even receiving credit for them. He is a nice man, but absolutely terrible professor.

The professor cares a lot about the subject and is passionate about it, and shows concern about whether the students are grasping the material. Note:  tests and quizzes are very detailed/hard and require a lot of time studying to get a good grade. Think an hour or so studying for a quiz, three or four for a test.

He is such a nice person. He is passionate about IA and tries hard to transmit his knowledge to students so he has high expectations from us. Go to class and you will learn a lot from him. He always asks if material is understood and makes himself available to discuss it further if necessary. Tests are easy if you READ and study. Gives extra credit

This is the only professor I have come across that takes the time to discuss with the class how the course can be approved. He asks for and implements feedback from the class. He is very strict & demands respect for the institution of academia. If you value being held to a standard and appeaciate a professional who strives for excellance-take him.
Gives very difficult quizzes and tests, becomes angry if people speak in class, threatens to dock grades from tests for phones ringing, etc. Avoid!

He is very vague rambles on A LOT never follows the course syllabus or the materials from the readings. He will offer little to no guidelines for papers and assignments but will grade harshly and if you ask for clarification he becomes frustrated and manages to dance around your question and will not answer a THING.

He is such a nice man. He does have an accent but he has very detailed power points. He could be very boring at times but very laid back. You have to work hard and actually study for the two tests but other then that very easy class.

I loved his class! It is an easy class if you go to class and review his power points. The book is needed for when he makes you write notes on a chapter/ he makes you know the Ga constitution. He is very helpful and flexible. There are only 2 test in his class, the midterm and the final. All his test come from his power points. He is GREAT!
